page.title: 11CRICKET IN CULMSTOCK
page.content: CRICKET is a popular sport played in the Village and CULMSTOCK CRICKET CLUB has its Home Ground in this area - a field given by a native of Culmstock for the use of the Club. There is a Pavilion and the setting is ideal. The Club, established around the beginning of the century, lapsed for a period but resumed just after the Second World War and is still flourishing and well supported. As a Village team, one finds many sons and grandsons follow in the footsteps of earlier members. Highlight of the year is the PRESIDENT'S MATCH when a team selected plays the Club team and villagers turn out in force. An ANNUAL DINNER DANCE is held when we hear of the Club's results for the past year.
